basics.name: Justin Jasper
basics.label: Computational Biologist, AI Researcher
basics.summary: Deeply passionate about leveraging the intersection of computational biology and machine learning to tackle complex challenges in biomedical research and development.

work.name: MITRE Corporation
work.summary: Developed automation software and AI-driven systems to optimize synthetic biology workflows.
highlights: Developed automation software for high-throughput training and fine-tuning of open-source large language models (LLMs).
Built an LLM-driven retrieval augmented generation (RAG) system using Python, LangChain, LlamaIndex, and Kubernetes.
Created the BioNet Domain-Specific Language for scaling synthetic biology experiments.

work.name: Omniwear AI
work.summary: Led the development of a B2B virtual try-on platform powered by computer vision and generative AI.
highlights: Secured partnerships with retail giants valued at over $1 billion.
Participated in Stanford’s Launchpad accelerator and Entrepreneur First’s NYC unicorn training program.

courses: Computational Biology: Structure and Organization of Biomolecules and Cells

skills.name: Computational
keywords: Deep Learning, Bayesian Statistics, LLM Training & Deployment

projects.name: CV Image Processing for CT and Ultrasound-based Tumor Detection
projects.summary: Developed a computer vision pipeline for lung CT scans using Python and OpenCV.
highlights: Achieved high accuracy in tumor segmentation using an Attention U-Net model.
Implemented K-means clustering for lung tissue classification.

projects.name: Synthetic Biosensor Development for Pathogen Detection
projects.summary: Engineered a novel biosensor using SynNotch receptors for Salmonella detection.
highlights: Optimized receptor expression using flow cytometry and Western blotting.
Utilized PCR, gel electrophoresis, and mammalian cell cultures.
